item.title: renovate
item.description: Run Locally Via Docker For Azure DevOps Git Safe Directory This doesn’t mount to the host /tmp, unlike examples in GitHub, because it asserts the directory as owned by the Docker user (likely root), leading to Git’s safe directory feature blocking it. For this scenario, it’s easier to disable mounting to the host because git config --global --add safe.directory /tmp/renovate/repos/* didn’t work as expected. Set the environment variables: export AZURE_DEVOPS_ORG=foo, AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT, and replace PROJECTNAME/REPO as required.
